definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Field observations were carried out at dozens of crosswalks in Xi an.
sentences.chinese: 在西安市選取了數十條人行橫道進行實地觀測。

sentences.english: If there is no crosswalk, stop at the edge of the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有人行橫道，以人行道的盡頭爲停車線。

sentences.english: The car knocked down an old man who was walking on the zebracrossing.
sentences.chinese: 這輛汽車撞倒了一個正在過人行橫道線的老人。

sentences.english: The restroom is just over there, beside the crosswalk.
sentences.chinese: 洗手間就在那兒，在人行橫道邊上。

sentences.english: They ought to stop at the pedestrian crossing.
sentences.chinese: 他們該停在人行橫道上。

sentences.english: When we need to cross the street, we should always use the pedestrian crossings or pedestrian bridges.
sentences.chinese: 過馬路時，我們一定要走人行橫道或過街天橋。

sentences.english: A path marked off for pedestrians crossing a street.
sentences.chinese: 過馬路時，我們一定要走人行橫道或過街天橋。

sentences.english: I think he should cross at the crosswalk.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他應該在人行橫道處過馬路。

sentences.english: We should go across a road at the crosswalk.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該在人行橫道處過馬路。

sentences.english: And one of the cornerstones of Beijing's madness is the lack of crosswalks.
sentences.chinese: 而且的基石之一，北京的瘋狂是缺乏人行橫道。

sentences.english: The car knocked down an old man who was walking on the zebra crossing.
sentences.chinese: 這輛汽車撞倒了一個正在過人行橫道線的老人。

sentences.english: When one crosses the street, one should take the crosswalk, underground passage or pedestrian overpass.
sentences.chinese: 當你穿過馬路，要走人行橫道或過街天橋，地下通道。

sentences.english: If there is no stop line, stop at the crosswalk.
sentences.chinese: 如公路上沒有劃線，在人行橫道前停車。

sentences.english: In a crosswalk, pedestrians have the right of way.
sentences.chinese: 在人行橫道上，行人有優先權。

sentences.english: A taxi is on the crosswalk.
sentences.chinese: 在人行橫道上有一輛出租車。

definition: (of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
